title: (x) Script/handwritten font with flourishes - custom designed {Alex}
content:
Does anyone know what font was used here: [http://www.outsidesource.com/post/font/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119150256/http:/www.outsidesource.com/post/font/ "http://www.outsidesource.com/post/font/")

I realize the flourishes were probably added, but the basic letterforms appear font-based. Any help is greatly appreciated. Thanks!

 [‹ Your favorite type I.D. resources](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119150256/http:/typophile.com/node/16415 "Go to previous forum topic") [font search: inside bjork dvd ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119150256/http:/typophile.com/node/16606 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mike2325

comments.content: These are custom-made letters. Just look at the two ’e’-s, they are quite different. House Industries, [http://www.houseindustries.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119150256/http:/www.houseindustries.com/ "http://www.houseindustries.com"), offer fonts with a similar flavour.

I can’t imagine that this was ever based on a font, however, you can view some brush scripts here  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=brush+script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119150256/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=brush+script "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=brush+script")

Tim
